properties.address: Buildwas Holy Trinity Church, Telford, Shropshire TF8 7DA
properties.description: Buildwas Village Place of Welcome is run by volunteers from Buildwas Holy Trinity Church. We want everyone in our neighbourhood to have a place to go for a friendly face, a cup of tea and a conversation if and when they need it. We share stories, advice, our talents and information - and lots of biscuits and cake! We are open every Saturday in the church (postcode: TF8 7DA) 11am - 1pm. We also hold our Buildwas Book Swap at the same time - bring a book and swap for another - and chat about what you've read with other visitors to our Place of Welcome. Our Place of Welcome is part of the wider network of Places of Welcome co-ordinated by the Church Urban Fund (CUF), Near Neighbours and the Together Network. During the winter (November - April), our Place of Welcome moves to Buildwas Village Hall (on Park View - postcode TF8 7BZ), a short walk from the church, as the church is currently too difficult to heat comfortably in the winter.
properties.title: Buildwas Holy Trinity Church

properties.address: Church Stretton Library and Visitor Information Centre, Church Stretton, Shropshire SY6 6DQ
properties.description: Church Stretton Library and Visitor Information Centre is a warm and welcoming space open to all. There are comfy places to sit, good books to read, friendly people to chat to and hot drinks available.
properties.title: Church Stretton Library and Visitor Information Centre

properties.address: Dawley Christian Centre, Telford, Shropshire TF4 2EX
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 1st October 2025** Our Coffee Bar sits up to 60 people in one sitting. We have a fully functioning kitchen and pleasant surroundings for people to sit in. From Monday to Thursday between 9-12:30pm we offer a space where people can come and relax and have a chat with others who are struggling o make ends meets. We have a team of volunteers who make a variety of home made soups for people to enjoy and visitors are also welcome to toast with their soup, or if they prefer they can have cheese on toast. Visitors are also welcome to as much tea and coffee and they can drink. We have a selection of books and games for people to use if they so wish, but in the main we find people want to come in and have a laugh with their friends. We are proud of the friendly atmosphere that we have at Dawley that genuinely welcomes all.
properties.title: Dawley Christian Centre Warm Space

properties.address: St. Giles Community Hall, Shropshire, Shropshire SY2 6EH
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 15th January 2025** Family Friendly drop-in after school. Re-starting January 15th, 3.30 - 5pm.
properties.title: St Giles Church Hall, Shrewsbury

properties.address: St Laurence Parish Centre, Church Stretton, Shropshire SY6 6DQ
properties.description: Every Saturday morning from October to March between 10-12 you will find a 'Warm Welcome' in St Laurence Parish Centre. We provide simple refreshments, good company, newspapers, games and conversation. Our space is accessible, inclusive and inter-generational so please come and join us on a Saturday and make some new friends!
properties.title: Stretton Parish, Church Stretton

properties.address: The Carpenter Family Centre, Telford, Shropshire TF3 5BT
properties.description: Tea, Toast and Talk was set up in January 2023 and takes place every Friday at the Carpenter Family Centre between 9.30am â€“ 11.30. It's a warm space where anyone can attend to meet/chat and make friends while having a warm drink (e.g. tea/coffee) and some toast. As part of these weekly sessions, there are normally some weekly activities taking place, which can include crafting and bingo. Some weeks during the year there may also be some partners/community groups that look to run some sessions, which have included blood pressure checks, health and wellbeing and internet safety.
properties.title: Tea, Toast and Talk - Carpenter Family Centre
